metadata.Title: CVE-2019-17177 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - low.
metadata.Description:
libfreerdp/codec/region.c in FreeRDP through 1.1.x and 2.x through 2.0.0-rc4 has memory leaks because a supplied realloc pointer (i.e., the first argument to realloc) is also used for a realloc return value.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-17177` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

freerdp2-shadow-x11 - 2.0.0~git20190204.1.2693389a+dfsg1-2
freerdp2-wayland - 2.0.0~git20190204.1.2693389a+dfsg1-2
freerdp2-x11 - 2.0.0~git20190204.1.2693389a+dfsg1-2
libfreerdp-client2-2 - 2.0.0~git20190204.1.2693389a+dfsg1-2
libfreerdp-server2-2 - 2.0.0~git20190204.1.2693389a+dfsg1-2
libfreerdp-shadow-subsystem2-2 - 2.0.0~git20190204.1.2693389a+dfsg1-2
libfreerdp-shadow2-2 - 2.0.0~git20190204.1.2693389a+dfsg1-2
libfreerdp2-2 - 2.0.0~git20190204.1.2693389a+dfsg1-2
libuwac0-0 - 2.0.0~git20190204.1.2693389a+dfsg1-2
libwinpr-tools2-2 - 2.0.0~git20190204.1.2693389a+dfsg1-2
libwinpr2-2 - 2.0.0~git20190204.1.2693389a+dfsg1-2
winpr-utils - 2.0.0~git20190204.1.2693389a+dfsg1-2
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> code is different in xenial and bionic, area mentioned in this CVE description doesn't exist.

criterions.comment: freerdp2 package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.0.0~git20190204.1.2693389a+dfsg1-2').
